Weird question from an long time gamer such as my self.  Are you going to evolve into making an MMORPG from the story line.

Before WoW there was Warcraft.  It played a lot like LoL in a way. (few spells, maps, background, etc) Then Warcarft 2 and 3.  With their games they had a very detail and interesting back story and champs.  This lead way to World of Warcraft.  They carried everything they worked on and learn to evolved it into a WoW.

League already had back stories, maps, and interest interactions with emotional stories.  TWOTLK imo was where the game left the basic story (had a lot of added things) of the Warcraft games.  Sure Rag, Kaz, etc really weren't in the story but added in.

Now I look at these awesome maps and back stories (well fiddle is still just standing around) but you have the hardest part of a MMORPG done.  and interesting story line and different characters interacting.  All you need is a bad guy win the rift and cause chaos upon the world.  Force the champions to ban together for a new fight.

To be honest we (the gaming community) need a new one.  Its been a while.  New games don't have the Brand name nor the stories that people already know to succeed.  That is one reason wow did so well.  You have brand name with loyalty.  Use it to your advantage.

Sure it will be harder than that.  But you already have a platform and understanding of on-line game and the tech aspects of it.  And imo is should be subscriptions base.  To get the money for the needed content and updating.

Just wonder if you have talked about the competitive advantages you have in the field compared to start ups.  And possibly making a transition like wow did.

OK, why does the map take literal 94% of my cpu!?

Tiot optimize this shit I have strong computer and I still can't run it wtf?!

Hi! Sorry to hear that.
If you're using Chrome, you can **Enable hardware acceleration**

1) Enter chrome://settings in the address bar at the top of Chrome. Or, use the menu button at the top right of the browser to choose Settings.
2) Scroll to the very bottom of that page and choose the Advanced link.
3) Now scroll to the very bottom of that page of settings to find some other options.
4) Under the "System" heading, locate and enable the Use hardware acceleration when available option.
5) If you're told to relaunch Chrome, go ahead and do that by exiting any open tabs and then opening Chrome again.

Let me know if this helps!

Since you asked for feedback, here it comes...
I love it! I always like to study maps of fictional worlds, they add a whole new layer of consistency to the universe. This one is nicely detailed and animated, an option to click on interesting point is great!
I have one question though: I noticed that there's no Institute of War anywhere on the Valoran continent. Does it mean that Riot is drifting from the 'summoners and summoned' idea? New and refreshed lore of the champions contains no info of how they got into League. I understand that previous approach was quite limiting for story writers, but on the other hand Summoner's Rift and all the gameplay makes no sense lore-wise if there is no Institue of War and League of Legends.
The IoW hasn't been canon for years. Currently, gameplay exists separately from the lore, much like Super Smash Bros exists separately from all the games it draws from.
